title: Sampler, 1974-42-13, 1772
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in counted and uncounted stitches: cross, satin, surface satin, stem and eyelet stitches on plain weave foundation
provenance: Ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
creditline: Bequest of Rosalie Coe, from the collection inherited from her mother, Eva Johnston Coe
description:
In the upper  half, bands of alphabets separated by narrow floral cross borders, a verse and inscription:
From my beginning may the almighty powers
Blessings bestow in never ceasing showers 
Oh may I happy be and dissipate all worldly cares 
And smiling peace bless my revolving years

Abigail Mears Her Sampler 1772

In the lower half, a scene of dogs chasing a stag. With a floral vine border on four sides.
